TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: pai timun a mareka nia vetjek a i Igiris, kaleva-i anan tua Tsemas.
pai timon a mareka nia vetjek a i Igiris, kaleva-i anan toa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: Our brothers and sisters in England, let us continue to rejoice in God.

S.FORM: pai a Tsemas, a ałak nimadju a kinaitaitan a ti Yisu-sama pasa maza i katsauanen sa tje paseqełingi anga, sa tje saneałaki anga a mapułat a i katsauan a tsautsau, sa tje paparevetjevetjeki anga a mapułat.

pai a Cemas, a aljak nimadjo a kinaitaitan a ti Yiso-sama pasa maza i kacaoanen sa tje paseqeljingi anga, sa tje sanealjaki anga a mapoljat a i kacaoan a caocao, sa tje paparevetjevetjeki anga a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: As for God he sent his only son Jesus here to the world, and we are saved, and all we human beings in the world are made his children, and we are all made brothers and sisters together.

S.FORM: maleva itjen aravats tua Tsemas.
maleva itjen aravac toa Cemas.
qau pai timun a nia kaka i Igiris tjaisangas mun a kemłang tua kiłivak nua Tsemas.
qao pai timon a nia kaka i Igiris tjaisangas mon a kemljang toa kiljivak noa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: Now you our brothers and sisters in England you first knew of the love of God.

S.FORM: nu djałunen amen a kemasi tsadja ravats i kaledep a sema maza i Tayuang.
no djaljonen amen a kemasi cadja ravac i kaledep a sema maza i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: You came to us from far away in the west to here in Taiwan.

S.FORM: pai ka alu a puluq a tsavił a tjaisangas imazanga mun a tjemautsiketsikel tjanuamen.
pai ka alo a poloq a cavilj a tjaisangas imazanga mon a tjemaocikecikel tjanoamen.
S.TRANSL: From 80 years ago you were here teaching us.

S.FORM: liaw anga aravats a kiukai imaza i Tayuang.
liaw anga aravac a kiokai imaza i Tayoang.
S.TRANSL: Now there are very many churches here in Taiwan.

S.FORM: pai tutsu a tsavił ka kemasi sikatjeluł tjuruvu anga aravats a nalemingdjeł tsa su umaq ta su kinatsautsauan a Tsemas.
pai toco a cavilj ka kemasi sikatjelolj tjorovo anga aravac a nalemingdjelj ca so omaq ta so kinacaocaoan a Cemas.
S.TRANSL: And now and in the last few years(?) very many people have built up your house your body, God.

S.FORM: pai aitsu tiamen a katsalisian kisusususu anga men a mapułat, natjełaving anga men tua nia sisalimsim tua mana nia pasalisaliw, malevaleva men aravats.
pai aico tiamen a kacalisian kisosososo anga men a mapoljat, natjeljaving anga men toa nia sisalimsim toa mana nia pasalisaliw, malevaleva men aravac.
S.TRANSL: And now we people of the mountain slopes have all become believers, we have passed the time of misery because of our sins; and we are very glad.

S.FORM: pai aitsu tisun a Tsemas a napaseqełing tjanuamen, saka timun uta a mareka nia vetjek a se Igiris a napadjałun tjanuamen tua kai nua Tsemas, sa aya men a malevaleva.
pai aico tison a Cemas a napaseqeljing tjanoamen, saka timon ota a mareka nia vetjek a se Igiris a napadjaljon tjanoamen toa kai noa Cemas, sa aya men a malevaleva.
S.TRANSL: We rejoice and say: You, God, have saved us, and you our brothers and sisters of England have brought to us the word of God.

S.FORM: pai ka sikatjeluł a tsavił nu sekaułan uta a ti Uaituun sinsi pasa maza i Tayuang, saka uri kitsaquan tua nia kai a katsalisian, sa uri katsalisiani anga su kai, maleva men uta aravats.
pai ka sikatjelolj a cavilj no sekaoljan ota a ti Uaitoon sinsi pasa maza i Tayoang, saka ori kicaqoan toa nia kai a kacalisian, sa ori kacalisiani anga so kai, maleva men ota aravac.
S.TRANSL: Two years ago you also sent teacher Whitehorn here to Taiwan, to learn our mountain language and to put your word into mountain language; we are very glad.

S.FORM: pai tu kinaimazan kisamułamuła aravats a kematsalisianan tua nia sizengzenger tua Tsemas a senay.
pai to kinaimazan kisamoljamolja aravac a kemacalisianan toa nia sizengzenger toa Cemas a senay.
S.TRANSL: During his time here he has worked hard to put into mountain language our songs of praise to God.

S.FORM: aitsu a nia, aitsu a kai uta nua Tsemas liaw anga uta a nia kinatsalisianan.
aico a nia, aico a kai ota noa Cemas liaw anga ota a nia kinacalisianan.
S.TRANSL: These our-the word of God too, we have put a lot into mountain language.

S.FORM: pai tutsu łemaluay anga men tua senay, łemaluay anga men tua kai nua Tsemas a pagału.
pai toco ljemaloay anga men toa senay, ljemaloay anga men toa kai noa Cemas a pagaljo.
S.TRANSL: So now we understand the songs, we understand the word of God a little.

S.FORM: malevaleva men uta aravats.
malevaleva men ota aravac.
qau pai aitsu namatsadjatsadja itjen aravats a i Igiris a i maza, łakua tjara ita tja kininemneman, tjara kisamułamuła-i sakamaya, tjara kalevaleva-i sakamaya, tjara zengezengeri sakamaya tua Tsemas.
qao pai aico namacadjacadja itjen aravac a i Igiris a i maza, ljakoa tjara ita tja kininemneman, tjara kisamoljamolja-i sakamaya, tjara kalevaleva-i sakamaya, tjara zengezengeri sakamaya toa Cemas.
S.TRANSL: And now we in England and here are very far apart, but certainly we are one in thought; so let us all work hard, let us all rejoice, let us all praise God.

S.FORM: qau pai aitsu tiamen a katsalisian imaza uri zemenger amen, uri malevanan amen, uri semukub amen tua Tsemas a palangda tjanumun a nia kaka i Igiris a mapułat.
qao pai aico tiamen a kacalisian imaza ori zemenger amen, ori malevanan amen, ori semokob amen toa Cemas a palangda tjanomon a nia kaka i Igiris a mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: And now we mountain people here are going to praise, to rejoice, to worship God, for all you our brothers and sisters in England to hear.
